explanation: Funds are available because they are early to need for the F-22 Sensor Enhancement Group B modification due to supply chain constraints and technology maturity demonstration delays which have delayed contract awards. The Air Force will address the phasing delay in future budget submissions. There are no other known program requirements for the funding at this time and no major impacts to the program.

Proceeds collected in the amount of $12,816,078.90 are required, in conjunction with FY 2021 proceeds collected, to procure Light Utility Helicopter airframes and associated equipment. The replacement property is an improved version of the items sold as part of the TH-67 Exchange and Sales Program. This is a base budget requirement.

Funds are required to procure communication security (COMSEC) equipment to maintain COMSEC inventory in accordance with Committee on National Security Systems Instruction No. 4007. The Multi-Service COMSEC Working Group and U.S. Civil Agencies shall identify equipment to be considered for procurement during the program build and validation process. Items to be procured are acceptable

Funds are available from the sale of thirty-two (32) obsolete Blackhawk helicopters via the BEST Program. The transactions were conducted through General Service Administration (GSA), with the transactions occurring from December 2020 through October 2021, totaling $27,172,667.14.
Funds are available from the sale to foreign partners of 13 Simple Key Loaders, 80 fill cables, 80 KIK-30s, and 71 KG-250s with transactions occurring between October 2020 and September 2021.
